entry.title: PetarV-/TikZ
entry.summary:
Complete collection of my PGF/TikZ figures.

TikZ

TikZ ist kein Zeichnenprogramm

Complete collection of my PGF/TikZ figures. I will do my best to keep it updated as soon as new figures are published.

Thanks

This collection could not have been made possible without the help of the following resources:

  • TeXample; the figures from here often provide a solid starting point.
  • LaTeX Stack Exchange; threads from here are typically the first results that pop up when googling for a particular technique/problem.

License

MIT

entry.title: alaarman/taiwan-2024
entry.summary:
beamer-universiteit-leiden

An unofficial LaTeX beamer template for scientific presentations in Universiteit Leiden layout, as described on their website.

A working example showcasing some of the functionality is provided in minimal.tex.

A matplotlib-style file is provided. Put the file in the same directory as you plotting code and add the following to the plot script to use:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.style.use('./leidenuniv.mplstyle')

Requirements

  • Any presentation needs to be compiled using xelatex in order to support the fonts.
  • Recent version of FontSpec to enable font-fallback.
  • The fonts Vestula or Minion are recommended for layout, but can not be redistributed.
